name: Midi
description: MIDI technology showcase with features, stats, and technical specifications

config.label: Description
config.placeholder: Precision you can hear. A minimal connector. Massive bandwidth. Designed for modern, per-note control.

config.label: Subscript
config.placeholder: Each MIDI 1.0 command uses 3 bytes. At 300,000 bytes/sec → 100,000 commands/sec (up to 150,000 with MIDI running state). With regular DIN MIDI, switching 1,000 pipes ON would take 1 second. With optical MIDI, it's ~1 millisecond. This bandwidth isn't overkill — continuous wind control can increase data needs dramatically.

config.label: Feature Description
config.placeholder: Uses MIDI 1.0 as extensive as possible (MIDI 2.0 can be implemented when it matures).
